name: Schott Hall
description: Home of the Office of Admissions & Student Financial Services. This is also where the academic departments of Modern Languages, Classics, Communication Arts, History are located.

name: Our Lady Of Peace Chapel
description: Dedicated by the Williams family, moved from their Family Estate in Anderson Township as a gift to the university in 2017. There's no services, but it's open for daily silent services 9am-5pm

name: Edgecliff Hall
description: home to our Department of Performing Arts and features music technology labs, soundproof practice studios, and Music Center recital halls

name: Schmidt Hall
description: Our administration building and office of our President, Dr. Colleen Hanycz

name: Hinkle Hall
description: Building for faculty offices; Departments of Math, English, Philosophy and Theology

name: McDonald Library
description: The building offers computer labs with access to printers, providing 1,000 sheets per semester, as well as study tables and quiet study areas. It includes access to OhioLink, a free service that allows students to request books from other university libraries in Ohio when Xavier University’s collection does not have the desired book. A makerspace is available for students, and the building is connected to the Conaton Learning Commons on two floors

name: Alter Hall
description: Renovated and reopened in the fall of 2015 to meet LEED Gold standards, the building features sustainable design elements, including an irrigation system on the roof, low-energy lighting, an energy recovery ventilator, and the use of recycled materials. The third floor houses an Honors Lounge, while classrooms are equipped with whiteboards or chalkboards on three of the four walls, along with two projector screens. The building primarily hosts general classes, including core subjects such as Theology, English, Philosophy, and Math, with the core curriculum consisting of 48 credits.

name: Albers Hall
description: Department of Biology is housed here. With 6 teaching labs and 7 project labs.

name: Logan Hall
description: Department Chemistry is housed here. Has chemistry lab rooms, classrooms, faculty offices, and a time capsules dedicated to the building. The time capsule is to be opened in 2053.

name: Lindner Family Physics Building
description: Department Physics is housed here. Also has a Astronomy observatory with 8 telescopes and Foucault Pendulum.

name: Hailstones Hall
description: Has multimedia classrooms and a computer lab. The Education department and the Graduate Office are also located here

name: Bellarmine Chapel
description: Serving as the home parish for hundreds of Catholics in Cincinnati and the Xavier community, this building is the spiritual center of the campus. Sunday Mass is held at 9:00 a.m., 11:30 a.m., and 7:00 p.m., with student-led Masses during the academic year at 4:00 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. Daily Masses are also conducted in the side chapel at 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. during the week.

name: Gallagher Student Center
description: The lower level features dining options that accept X-Cash and Dining Dollars, as well as the Performing Arts Theatre and Studio Theatre. On level one, you'll find the Welcome Desk, where students can check out laptops, along with the Bookstore offering textbooks, school supplies, snacks, and a convenience store, a printing station, and Victory Perk café. Level two includes the US Bank branch, the Student Activities Council, Student Government, the Center for Diversity and Inclusion, the Center for International Education, and Student Involvement. Level three houses the Dorothy Day Center for Faith and Justice, Student Affairs and Enrichment, the Title IX office, Interfaith Community Engagement, the Clock Tower Lounge, and the Commuter Lounge.

name: Brockman Hall
description: Housing for first year students thats co-ed, separated by floor. Community-style living with shared bathrooms, which are cleaned daily by physical plant staff. All residence halls include laundry facilities, full kitchens, study lounges, and a recreation room.

name: Buenger Residence Hall
description: Priority housing for first-year and sophomore students, athletes, and honors students; co-ed by suite. Most suites have two double occupancy bedrooms. Some suites feature three double occupancy bedrooms, and a few offer three or four single occupancy bedrooms. Suites include a furnished common area, one and a half bathrooms, and a kitchenette with a microwave, refrigerator, and sink.

name: Kuhlman Residence Hall
description: Housing for first-year and sophomore students, co-ed by wing and floor. Features two double occupancy bedrooms connected by a shared bathroom.

name: Husman Residence Hall
description: Housing for first-year and sophomore students, co-ed by wing and floor. Features two double occupancy bedrooms connected by a shared bathroom.

name: Cintas Center
description: Seats 10,244 people. Contains classrooms and lounge areas. Students tickets are included in tuition. Hosts Xavier's men's and women's basketball games and women's volleyball games. Banquet and event rooms are also located here.

name: Cohen Center
description: Houses the Department of Art and the Xavier University Art Gallery. Home to the Departments of Criminal Justice, Social Work, Occupational Therapy, Health Services Administration (Graduate), and some education classes.Nursing faculty offices are also located here.

name: Flynn Hall
description: Home to Xavier's Police Department. The staff of professional officers is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Our blue assistance light system, located in various places on campus, connects students in an emergency situation to the police station to talk to a respondent.

name: Health United Building (HUB)
description: Home to Health Services (Nursing, OT, Exercise Science) with state-of-the-art simulation labs as well as classrooms and 12 private study rooms. Rec Center with 4 lane pool, 3 group fitness studios, and 3 full-size multi purpose courts. As well as on-campus pharmacy.

name: Hoff Dining Commons
description: Open 7 a.m.-9 p.m. on weekdays and 8 a.m.-8 p.m. on weekends. • Features five kitchens in an all-you-care-to-eat format, including fresh soups, salads and vegan selections, comfort foods and foods cooked to order, fresh baked breads and desserts, made-to-order deli sandwiches and a stone hearth pizza oven. Pizza ATM located outside the dining commons, provides medium (12-inch) pizzas in only 3 minutes

name: Smith Hall
description: The Williams College of Business features the 5/3rd Trading Center, equipped with Bloomberg terminals and recognized as the largest facility of its kind among universities in the country. It spans four floors, encompassing all undergraduate and graduate business programs, the Professional Development Center, and Corporate Connections. The college is also home to the D’Artagnan Capital Fund, a student-run initiative that manages real money, and the Sedler Family Center for Experiential Learning.

name: Conaton Learning Commons
description: The building houses the Office of Academic Assistance, TRiO, Student Success and Retention, and the Career Service Center. The 4th floor features the Writing Center, Math and Language Lab, while the 5th floor is home to the Veteran and Military Family Center. The Connection Center on the lower floor includes the main library desk and the Help Desk for technical assistance. There are also 16 group study rooms with dry erase walls, all connected to the library.
